item.title: Report E-2023090755
item.description:
Report E-2023090755

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-02T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-07
  • City: CASEYVILLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: When driver went to go hook to trailer in drop lot he noticed liquid coming from trailer on the gravel lot. Driver then notified facility manager and a team was dispatcher out to facilitate the clean up. The trailer was moved to the dock to pull the container off and put on a containment pallet and absorbent was put down to prevent any spread of the material until the team could start the clean up. The response team arrived and had to remove the material from the container and put into a new one. Gravel from the lot had to be removed creating three 55 gallon drums of material. The inner liner of the bag was determined to be damaged from when it was filled causing the release. From the time it was identified to when clean up was complete was approximately 4 hours.

item.title: Report E-2023090754
item.description:
Report E-2023090754

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-02T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-19
  • City: SPRINGFIELD
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 19, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1157 was forked and released approximately thirty (30) gallons of product to the trailer floor and concrete parking lot. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from ES Plus, LLC (ESP) to remediate the impacted surfaces. . ESP transferred the damaged drum from the trailer to an 85-gallon salvage drum. The crew deployed granular absorbents to the trailer floor and concrete parking lot. ESP utilized hand tools to collect the spent absorbents into three (3) 55-gallon drums for transport and disposal by R+L.

item.title: Report E-2023090752
item.description:
Report E-2023090752

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-02T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-19
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 19, 2023, one (1) 1-gallon jug of UN3264 was forked and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel deployed granular absorbents and a neutralizing agent to the UN3264-impacted dock and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents, the damaged jug, and debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum to be staged onsite for future disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023090725
item.description:
Report X-2023090725

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-28T15:12:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-12
  • City: BELLEVILLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: DESIGNATED RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO UNLOAD 4 FOR A LEAKER. WHEN THE RESPONDER ARRIVED IN FULL PPE, HE NOTICED ONE OF THE LEAKED ON PACKAGES WAS A HAZMAT WITH SHIPPING PAPERS. RESPONDER TRANSPORTED THE PACKAGE TO DMP IMMEDIATELY AND ISOLATED THE PACKAGE. AFTER THE RESPONDER TRANSPORTED ALL PACKAGES TO THE DMP AND IDENTIFIED THE LEAKING PACKAGE, THE RESPONDER ATTENDED TO THE HAZMAT AND DISCOVERED IT HAD A BOTTLE THAT WAS LEAKING IN ADDITION TO BEING LEAKED ON. THE RESPONDER LOCATED THE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET AND PROCESSED THROUGH THE DMP.

item.title: Report E-2023090687
item.description:
Report E-2023090687

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-27T18:15:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-12
  • City: MATTESON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 12, 2023, one (1) 275-gallon tote of UN1792 had a faulty valve and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted dock and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 15-gallon drum. Crews transferred the material from the 330-gallon tote into a new one. HCE personnel cut up the old tote and placed the pieces into three (3) 55-gallon drums. All containers were staged onsite for future disposal.

item.title: Report I-2023090069
item.description:
Report I-2023090069

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-26T18:14:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-02
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED AIRLINES HOLDINGS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 1
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It appears that the shipment was punctured by a forklift upon moving into the truck for transport (after being flown). It was not noticed until the next day when it was to be picked up. Agent tried to clean up and inhaled the stuff, was advised to go to hospital to be checked out and was kept for observation- OSHA - inhalation warning. Shipment was cleaned up by a HAZMAT team • AWB#75875343- 28-piece shipment- split between two flights 928/959 on 8/31/23.• 4 pieces on 928, 24 pieces on 959• Shipment was placed on reefer truck on 8/31• Driver came to pick up shipment on 9/2 around 1300, noticed the powder, and immediately refused to pick up shipment.• Faro Employee Leticia Alvarez went to investigate and began to try to clean up the area. UA management advised at the time• Hazchem on site at 6pm for cleanup, 3 damaged boxes removed after clean up due to punctures in the boxes and leaking. Hazchem contact: Allan Mandell 330 S.Fairbank Street Addison IL (630} • Attempted to contact local environmental coordinator at 2:20pm

  • Description: RESPONDED TO THREE PACKAGES THAT WERE WET AND FALLING APART DUE TO THE CONDENSATION FROM DRY ICE. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY TEN POUNDS OF DRY ICE COOLING DOG FOOD. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOXES. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBERS TO VARIOUS CONSIGNEES IN THE USA ARE 1Z0956E2P126741435 AND 1Z0956E2P136090503.

item.title: Report X-2023090419
item.description:
Report X-2023090419

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-02T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-28
  • City: DECATUR
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package brought to QA with a wet, torn box. Bottle of Chlorine Sanitizer with a loose cap had leaked liquid into package which ate away at the cardboard. Exterior box did not have any hazmat placarding or identification at all. Box was isolated in QA. After inspecting contents saw possible hazmat item and checked SDS. DescribePack: Bottle of chlorine solution has cap that came loose, seal underneath cap became punctured or torn allowing chlorine solution to leak out into box and to eat away at it. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was isolated in lined tote.

item.title: Report X-2023090315
item.description:
Report X-2023090315

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-28T15:12:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-30
  • City: ROMEOVILLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found wet and leaking a brown liquid after being unloaded from facility 537 after going over their overhead sorter. Package was found around 11:09am. Package smelled severely of alcohol. Package was not labeled a Hazmat but upon research via the Safety Data Sheet, it was determined that the product was a Category 3 Flammable Liquid. Package was immediately taken to the HazMat Cage in order to isolate it from the rest of the staff. DescribePack: 1 of the 4 plastic bottles inside the box had a very large tear at the shoulder of the item. This led to a leakage of Hazardous materials. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Package was taken to the HazMat Cage for isolation and processing.

item.title: Report X-2023090287

item.title: Report X-2023090481
item.description:
Report X-2023090481

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-26T18:14:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-25
  • City: PALATINE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED FOR A PACKAGE THAT SUPERVISOR DESCRIBED AS AN UNDECLARED HAZMAT. ARRIVED AT THE LOCATION IN FULL PPE, TO FIND A PACKAGE IN THE REAR OF THE VEHICLE THAT WAS LEAKING A DARK LIQUID. RESPONDER USED PH TAPE ON THE LIQUID, AND IT READ A PH OF 0. THIS LED RESPONDER TO USE THE CORROSIVE RESPONSE SHEET, AND RESPONDER NEUTRALIZED THE LIQUID WITH SODIUM BICARBONATE. RESPONDER THEN RETESTED THE PH OF THE MATERIAL, AND GOT A 6. RESPONDER FINISHED CLEANING THE VEHICLE WITH ZEP ZORBENT. RESPONDER CONTAINERIZED THE PACKAGE AND SPILL MATERIAL IN SPILL TUBS. WHILE RESPONDER WAS FINISHING THE CLEAN UP IN THE VEHCLE, CALLED ADDITIONAL RESPONDER TO ASSIST RESPONDER IN TRANSPORTING ALL THE MATERIAL BACK TO THE DMP. DURING THE TIME OF MOVING THE PACKAGE ONTO A SPILL CART, THE PACKAGE OPEN MORE, AND STARTED TO EMIT VISIBLE FUMES. FACILITY CALLED OUTSIDE RESPONDER.

item.title: Report E-2023090688
item.description:
Report E-2023090688

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-27T18:15:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-20
  • City: GODFREY
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: GROENDYKE TRANSPORT INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver pulled up at store/Driver put out cones/Driver started to work on his paperwork outside the cab/ Driver started hooking his vapor and product hoses up/Driver didn't stick tanks/SSS on call personnel and TM couldn't confirm if the driver checked his veeder root due to the driver behind the cab on passenger side/Driver started to unload prior to working on his paperwork/Driver broke the measuring stick and put them down in the drop tubes to hold the flappers open on both tanks during unloading/Driver notified by QT personnel onsite regarding high level alarm/Driver continues to unload into both tanks/Driver removed hoses off truck after not properly draining them and spilled EUG out of the hoses/Driver removed drop guns and measuring sticks from both drops and one of them started to over flow onto the concrete/Driver started the cleanup process.
